sub_concepts.name: String Theory
sub_concepts.definition: A theoretical framework in which the point-like particles of particle physics are replaced by one-dimensional objects called strings.

sub_concepts.name: Bosonic String Theory
sub_concepts.definition: The original version of string theory, which only includes bosons.

sub_concepts.name: Superstring Theory
sub_concepts.definition: A type of string theory that includes both bosons and fermions in its spectrum.

sub_concepts.name: Type I String Theory
sub_concepts.definition: A superstring theory that includes open and closed strings.

sub_concepts.name: Type IIA String Theory
sub_concepts.definition: A superstring theory that includes only closed strings and has two supersymmetries.

sub_concepts.name: Type IIB String Theory
sub_concepts.definition: A superstring theory that includes only closed strings and has two supersymmetries, with one of them chiral.

sub_concepts.name: Heterotic String Theory
sub_concepts.definition: A superstring theory that includes both open and closed strings, and has one supersymmetry.

sub_concepts.name: M-Theory
sub_concepts.definition: A conjectured theory that unifies the five consistent string theories and 11-dimensional supergravity.

sub_concepts.name: Branes
sub_concepts.definition: Objects in string theory that generalize the concept of a point particle to higher dimensions.

sub_concepts.name: D-Branes
sub_concepts.definition: A specific type of brane that is electrically charged under the Ramond-Ramond fields.
